intro: Vitellariopsis cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed vitellaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and thrives in areas with moderate to high rainfall. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
